intro: Rhytidostemma surinamense, commonly known as the Surinam starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Suriname and Guyana. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped, yellow flowers and has a woody stem with a distinctive, rough texture. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
